episodes.title: Epstein Files LIVE: Trump Mentioned Repeatedly, Lawmaker Demands Answers | WION
episodes.description:
Representative Jamie Raskin said searches within portions of the unredacted Jeffrey Epstein records produced more than one million references to terms linked to U.S. President Donald Trump.

Raskin noted that he did not personally review every result but described the volume of entries as notable. The remarks have intensified debate over the handling and interpretation of the Epstein documents, renewing calls for transparency and scrutiny.

episodes.title: Epstein Files Controversy Deepens: Congresswoman’s Search History Revealed | WORLD DNA
episodes.description:
Newly released DOJ documents have deepened the Epstein Files controversy, revealing a Congresswoman’s search history tied to the investigation. The exposure has sparked intense debate in political and media circles, raising questions about privacy, oversight, and transparency in high-profile investigations. Analysts and legal experts are weighing the implications of these revelations for ongoing proceedings and political accountability. This latest development sheds new light on the Epstein case and the broader scrutiny of lawmakers connected, directly or indirectly, to related inquiries.

#epsteinfiles #congressmen #doj #usa #wion

episodes.title: Epstein’s Secret Science: Plan to Create Genetically Superior Humans | WION Top Stories
episodes.description:

His vision, often linked to transhumanism and eugenics, has raised significant ethical concerns and drawn scrutiny from scientific and legal communities.

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Kenya Starvation Cult Horror: 5 More Bodies Found in Shallow Graves Near Malindi | WION
episodes.description:
Kenyan authorities have recovered five more bodies in shallow graves near Malindi, Kilifi County, at a site linked to a suspected religious cult. The area is close to the infamous Shakahola Forest, where over 400 cult-related deaths were reported in 2023. Officials suspect the victims were starved or suffocated due to extreme religious practices. Investigations continue, with 11 suspects under scrutiny as fears grow over missing children in the region.

episodes.title: Self-proclaimed prophet arrested & charged in Zimbabwe | World Of Africa
episodes.description:
A Zimbabwean sect leader and "self-styled prophet" appeared in court charged with child abuse after police raided his farm and rescued more than 200 children doing physical labour. A police statement said the children "were subjected to abuse as cheap labour, doing manual work in the name of being taught life skills".

Police found 251 children on the farm who were not attending school, most of whom did not have birth certificates. They also found 16 graves, including seven for infants, all which were unregistered.

episodes.title: Nigeria's Kano state holds mass wedding | World of Africa
episodes.description:
Mass weddings were held annually in Nigeria's northern state for many years until the previous administration discontinued the practice. The current governor had pledged to revive the ceremony, which was one of his key campaign promises. The Kano state government hosted a mass wedding, joining 1,800 couples in matrimony, mainly widows and divorcees selected from the 44 local government areas of the state.

episodes.title: Gravitas: Shinzo Abe's killer claims cult link behind murder
episodes.description:
The mystery around Shinzo Abe's assassination is getting more intense. His killer #TetsuyaYamagami says Abe's links to a religious cult motivated his actions. Which cult is he talking about? How was Abe linked to it? Palki Sharma reports.

episodes.title: WION Fineprint | Google embroiled in religious controversies
episodes.description:
Google seems to have a 'cult' problem. According to a former employee who was fired, a religious sect has gained massive influence over Google's developer studio, hiring several members from the group. Molly Gambhir tells you more.

#Google #Religion #WION

episodes.title: Gravitas: Chinese Female Jesus Cult: A new threat for India
episodes.description:
A Chinese Christian cult is allegedly making inroads in India. The Church of Almighty God is a violent movement - that believes Jesus has returned as a Chinese woman. Nagaland's highest church body is raising an alarm. Palki Sharma Upadhyay tells you more.


#Gravitas #WION #FemaleJesusCult

episodes.title: Japan executes Doomsday cult leader behind Tokyo sarin attacks
episodes.description:
Seven members of the Aum Shinrikyo doomsday cult which carried out a deadly nerve gas attack on the Tokyo underground in 1995 have been executed, including cult leader Shoko Asahara.
